quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Jupiter and Hormone
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, field, jupiter. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The production of the hormone melatonin is inhibited by light and permitted by darkness. In which part of the body is it produced?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Progesterone, the hormone of pregnancy, is synthesized in this part of the body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: How oblate is Saturn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: .1

questions.question: Jupiters magnetic field is the strongest in the Solar System.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Saturns magnetic field is stronger than Earths.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Testosterone is a male hormone secreted in the testes in males and ovaries in females. Its deficiency is related to various disorders such as this one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alzheimer’s Disease

questions.question: Jupiter has been called the vacuum cleaner of the Solar System.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about cortisol, a hormone produced by the cortex of the adrenal glands?

options.text: Lack of sleep increases cortisol levels.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: How many natural satellites does Jupiter have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 63

questions.question: Which of the following groups of animals does nematology study?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roundworms

questions.question: How large can Jupiter appear in the Earths sky?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 50 arcseconds

questions.question: The first moons of Jupiter discovered belong to this group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Galilean Moons

questions.question: How fast have winds on Jupiter blown?

options.text: 430 Kilometers per hour(267 Miles per hour)
240 Kilometers per hour(150 Miles per hour)
470 Kilometers per hour(292 Miles per hour)
360 Kilometers per hour(223 Miles per hour)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 430 Kilometers per hour(267 Miles per hour)

questions.question: Jupiter is growing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the female hormone estrogen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Science and Study
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, biology, brunners. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Ichthyology is a branch of biology that deals with which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fish

questions.question: What type of duct is the Whartons duct found in the human body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salivary duct

questions.question: In which gland of the human body can Hurthle cells be found?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thyroid gland

questions.question: The science known as theriology or therology studies which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mammals

questions.question: In which part of the digestive system are the so-called Brunners glands located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duodenum

questions.question: In what part of the human body are Von Ebners glands located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tongue

questions.question: Which of the following groups of animals does helminthology study?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parasitic worms

questions.question: What animals does malacology study?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mollusks

questions.question: Which insects does the science called Coleopterology study?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beetles

questions.question: What does carcinology study?

options.text: Malignant tumors in animals and humans
The outer shells of invertebrates and reptiles

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crustaceans

questions.question: What is the subject of study of the science called oology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eggs

questions.question: Which of these animals does dipterology study?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flies

questions.question: The science called myrmecology deals with the study of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ants

questions.question: The so-called space of Disse is located in this internal organ of the human body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liver

questions.question: What type of cells are Betz cells that are found in the human body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neurons

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Fungi and Production
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, biology, process. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Fungi and their products are involved in the process of production of which of these goods?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Fungi take important part in which phase of the nutrient cycling and exchange?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Organic matter decomposition

questions.question: What kind of therapy is the Tui na, used in traditional Chinese medicine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Massage

questions.question: Fungi are crucial for the production of which of these foods?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bread

questions.question: A fungus of the Armillaria ostoyae genus, discovered in the Malheur National Forest in the Strawberry Mountains of eastern Oregon, U.S. is often cited as which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The largest living organism

questions.question: For which of these global tendencies in nature are fungi responsible?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Decline of amphibian populations

questions.question: How is the discipline of biology dedicated to the study of fungi called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mycology

questions.question: How do fungi reproduce?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In which part of the human body are Sharpeys fibers found?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: According to scientific classifications, to which kingdom do fungi belong?

options.text: To both the animal and the plant kingdom

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: In nature, fungi are known tp form symbiotic relationships with which of these organisms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The pores of Kohn are organs located in this part of the human body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lungs

questions.question: What is the main difference between fungi and plants when cell structure is considered?

options.text: Fungi do not have cellulose in their cell walls

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fungi do not have cellulose in their cell walls

questions.question: What human internal organ contains Luschkas crypts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gallbladder

questions.question: The meibomian glands are special sebaceous glands located in this part of the human body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eyelids

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Country and Traditional Chinese Medicine
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, lighter, mushrooms. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What part of the human being is the shen according to traditional Chinese medicine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soul

questions.question: U.S. President George Washington was the most famous person to use an early form of dentures. What material were his dentures made from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hippopotamus ivory

questions.question: In what country was silk first produced?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: What type of herbs are used in traditional Chinese medicine to trigger sweating and invigorate blood?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pungent herbs

questions.question: In what century was the first form of the lighter created?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 16th century

questions.question: Which of these methods is used in traditional Chinese medicine to diagnose conditions and diseases?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What positive effect do shiitake mushrooms, largely used in traditional Chinese medicine, have on human health?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In what country was the modern safety pin created?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United States

questions.question: Archaeological findings suggest that true glass was first invented in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egypt

questions.question: Qigong, which is recommended in traditional Chinese medicine, is what type of exercise?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breathing

questions.question: Ginseng is widely used in traditional Chinese medicine. What is the meaning of the Chinese phrase renshen, from which the English word ginseng originated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Man root

questions.question: What traditional Chinese food is believed to improve the skin and the function of the spleen, and to promote appetite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bird nest

questions.question: In what country did reconstructive and plastic surgery originate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India

questions.question: What part of a ducks body is recommended for treating coughs in traditional Chinese medicine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gizzard

questions.question: What animal cures asthma, arteriosclerosis, impotence, thyroid problems, broken bones, and heart disease according to traditional Chinese medicine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seahorse

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Aristotle and Socrates
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, males, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Finish the popular quote by the great Greek philosopher Aristotle: ‘There was never a genius without a tincture of…’.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Madness

questions.question: What was the most important occupation to Socrates according to Xenophons ‘Symposium’?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Discussing philosophy

questions.question: In what century did the great Greek philosopher Aristotle live?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4th century BC

questions.question: What is the nature of the so-called Socratic Method of inquiry?

options.text: Answering a question with another question
Asking the same question many times by rephrasing it
Answering a foolish question with a more foolish answer
Asking very personal questions to embarrass the other party

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Answering a question with another question

questions.question: How did Socrates describe the so-called ‘demonic sign’ that he claimed to appear to him when he was about to make a mistake?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inner voice

questions.question: Socrates believed that wrongdoing stems only from this phenomenon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ignorance

questions.question: Aristotle believed these two scientific fields had nothing in common.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mathematics and physics

questions.question: According to Socrates, people should worry most about which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Their souls

questions.question: In what type of written form did Aristotle prefer to express and defend his doctrines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dialogue

questions.question: According to Socrates, the ideal state had this type of governmental control.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Military communism

questions.question: What astronomical object was named in honor of Greek philosopher Aristotle?

options.text: One of the rings of Saturn

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A crater on the Moon

questions.question: Aristotle believed in the existence of this anatomical difference between human males and females.

options.text: Females were born without a brain, and it was formed later.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Males had more teeth.

questions.question: In what century did the great Greek philosopher Socrates live?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5th century BC

questions.question: Socrates had a successful service in this state institution in Athens.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Military

questions.question: What did Aristotle request of his student Alexander the Great, according to some sources?

options.text: That he would keep his teachings a secret
That he would marry his daughter
That he would rebuild his hometown

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: That he would rebuild his hometown

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Term and Abbreviation
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, computers, condition. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the world of computers, what does PC stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Personal Computer

questions.question: USB connectors let you attach everything from printers to cameras to your computer quickly and easily. What does the abbreviation USB actually stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Universal Serial Bus

questions.question: WWW, an abbreviation well known to Internet lovers, actually stands for what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World Wide Web

questions.question: This medical condition is characterized by subsequent decay of body tissues, caused by infection or thrombosis or lack of blood flow.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gangrene

questions.question: This mental illness, classified by Emil Kraepelin in 1887, is characterized by persistent disorders in the perception or expression of reality.  A person who suffers from this disease may have delusions, hallucinations, disorganized or catatonic behavior.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Schizophrenia

questions.question: A chalazion, also known as a Meibomian gland lipogranuloma, refers to which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A cyst on the eyelid

questions.question: Which medical term refers to the crackling sound, produced when two rough surfaces in the human body come into contact?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crepitus

questions.question: This medical term refers to a condition, characterized by enlargement of the thyroid gland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goiter

questions.question: What was the nature of sciences according to Aristotle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Alopecia is the medical term which refers to baldness.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This disease is characterized by the presence of the following symptoms: recurrent, episodic vertigo, hearing loss, a sensation of aural fullness and tinnitus.  It is a balance disorder of the inner ear, first described by a French physician in 1861.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Menieres Disease

questions.question: The term albino comes from the Latin word albus.  An albino person or animal is characterised by what?

options.text: Extremely dark pigmentation of the skin
A lack of pigmentation in the skin, eyes and hair

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A lack of pigmentation in the skin, eyes and hair

questions.question: Windows NT is a family of operating systems produced by Microsoft. What does NT stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Technology

questions.question: Urticaria is a relatively common form of allergic reaction, that causes red skin welts. Which is the other term which refers to this skin ailment?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hives

questions.question: Which word refers to a sound caused by abnormal or pathological heart valves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Murmur
